## GAD-7 vs CDI

Comparative studies utilizing research instruments such as GAD-7 (Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment) and CDI (Children's Depression Inventory) offer valuable insights into psychological conditions. However, the harmonization of these separate scales may present challenges, especially when attempting to detect correlations or disparities. This is where software such as Harmony proves most beneficial. Harmony's multi-lingual natural language processing and AI technology expedite the harmonization process, enabling a succinct comparison of GAD-7 vs CDI. Researchers can easily input elements from both GAD-7 and CDI in their native languages into Harmony's interface, from there, Harmony can calculate the similarity between items. Exploiting the potential of Harmony for 'GAD-7 vs CDI' harmonisation can drastically reduce time investment and subjectivity, producing dependable comparative studies. For a deep-seated understanding in the field of psychology or social science, conducting concise instrument comparisons such as 'GAD-7 vs CDI' seems indispensable. If you are embarking on such venture, consider employing Harmony's advanced AI capabilities to drastically simplify the process, ultimately elucidating lucid correlations and contrasts between GAD-7 and CDI. Harmony is undeniably a powerful tool aiding researchers to efficiently bridge between questionnaires, ensuring valuable psychological research continues to progress.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and CDI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and CDI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CDI into Harmony</a> - compare CDI with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
